definitions.definition: Straightness ; the state or quality of having a constant direction and not being crooked or bent.
The fact or quality of being right or correct ; correctness of opinion or judgement.
Conformity to the rules prescribed for moral conduct ; (moral) uprightness , virtue .

main_definition: Straightness ; the state or quality of having a constant direction and not being crooked or bent. [from 15th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( now rare ) The fact or quality of being right or correct ; correctness of opinion or judgement. [from 15th c.]
Conformity to the rules prescribed for moral conduct ; (moral) uprightness , virtue . [from 16th c.]
